structured.description: A dropzone component using the jQuery library, which enables users to upload files and display their status. The code also includes functionality for processing uploaded images, including validation and delayed loading. Additionally, it initializes Google Analytics tracking on the page.

items.description: Initializes a Dropzone and toggles an about panel.

Checks if a file exists at a specified location, then waits for a short time before attempting to check again up to a maximum number of times. If the file does not exist after these attempts, it displays an image element in the UI.

params.name: fileName
params.description: Used to identify an image file name.

params.name: i
params.description: Used as a counter for recursion.

items.name: delayThenShowImages

items.description: Checks if a specified URL exists by sending a HEAD request to the server and verifying that the response status is not 404 (Not Found). It returns a boolean value indicating whether the URL exists or not.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL to be checked for existence.

returns.description: True if the URL exists and false otherwise, indicating whether a HEAD request to the specified URL results in a status code other than 404.

items.name: UrlExists

structured.description: A BrowserDetect object that detects the browser and operating system of the user's device by parsing the navigator.userAgent string and other properties. It uses an array of objects with specific search strings, substrings, and version search patterns to identify the browser and OS. The detected information is then stored in the client object.

items.description: Initializes browser, version and operating system (OS) information by searching for specific strings in userAgent or appVersion properties. If not found, it sets default values.
items.name: init

items.description: Iterates over an array of objects, extracting a string and property from each object. It searches for a substring within the string or checks if the property exists. If a match is found, it returns the identity value associated with the matching object.

returns.description: `data[i].identity`, where `i` is an index of the array `data`. The actual returned value may be one of the elements in the `data` array or null if no match is found.

items.name: searchString

items.description: Extracts a version number from a given string, starting with a predefined search string. If found, it parses the version number as a floating-point number and returns it; otherwise, it returns nothing (i.e., undefined).

returns.description: Parsed from a substring of the input string, starting after the position where the search string was found. If no match is found, an undefined value is returned.

items.name: searchVersion

structured.description: A jQuery plugin called Dropzone that enables file uploads via drag-and-drop functionality. It extends the default options with those provided and adds event listeners for dragenter, dragover, and drop events. The plugin supports multiple concurrent uploads, logs upload progress and speed, and provides callbacks for new files dropped, upload started, finished, and progress updated.

items.description: Stops propagation and prevents default action for a drag event, effectively preventing the browser's default behavior when an element is entered while dragging an item. This ensures that the dropped item can be handled by the application instead of being processed by the browser.

params.name: event
params.description: Used to prevent default browser behavior.

items.name: dragenter

items.description: Stops event propagation and prevents default browser behavior for a dragged-over element, allowing the application to handle the drag operation instead. It returns `false` to indicate that the event has been handled.

usage.description: This code sets up a div element with event listeners for drop and drag-over events.

items.name: dragover

items.description: Handles drag-and-drop file uploads. When a file is dropped onto an element, it retrieves the dropped files, prevents the default browser behavior, and calls the `uploadFiles` function to handle the file upload process.

usage.description: The div with id "drop-area" will trigger the drop function when a file is dropped onto it.

items.name: drop

items.description: Checks if the `printLogs` option is set to true. If it is, it logs a message using the `console.log` method if `console` object exists. The logged message is passed as an argument to this function.

usage.description: The above code would print "Hello World" if opts.printLogs is set to true.

items.name: log

items.description: Uploads a list of files to a server using XMLHttpRequest. It creates an XMLHttpRequest object for each file, sets headers and listeners, and sends the file data. The function also updates a dropzone's UI state during the upload process.

params.name: files
params.description: Used to pass an array of files for upload.

items.name: uploadFiles

items.description: Updates a timestamp difference for the current file upload and triggers an event to notify the completion of uploading, logging a message to indicate the finished loading process.

params.name: event
params.description: Triggered by a file loading operation completion.

usage.description: The code above demonstrates a basic invocation of the `load` function, passing in a custom object with properties `downloadStartTime`, `fileIndex`, and `fileObj`.

items.name: load

items.description: Updates the progress of a file upload by calculating the percentage completed and triggering events for speed update when the upload rate refresh time is reached.

params.name: event
params.description: Used to track file upload progress.

usage.code:
var event = {loaded: 100, total: 500}; // Simulating a file upload event
progress(event);

items.name: progress

items.description: Handles an event triggered by a file input element. It prevents the default action, retrieves all selected files, and then uploads them using the `uploadFiles` function.

params.name: event
params.description: Triggered by an HTML file input field change event.

usage.description: This code will trigger the change() function whenever a file is selected.

items.name: change
